inference:
Reflecting the graph of $y = f(x)$ across the x-axis gives the graph of $y = -f(x)$.  The graph of $y = f(x)$ is given.  The graph of $y = -f(x)$ is obtained by reflecting each point $(x, y)$ on the graph of $y = f(x)$ across the x-axis to the point $(x, -y)$.  Therefore, the y-values of the graph of $y = -f(x)$ are the negative of the y-values of the graph of $y = f(x)$. The graph of $y = -f(x)$ is graph B.

Final Answer: $\boxed{B}$
ground_truth: The graph of $y = -f(x)$ is the reflection of the graph of $y = f(x)$ in the $x$-axis.  The correct graph is $\boxed{\text{B}}.$
